Store Roasted Chicken with Herb Potatoes

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a quick and delicious dinner idea? This Store Roasted Chicken with Herb Potatoes recipe is the perfect solution for busy weeknights or impromptu gatherings. With just a few ingredients, including a juicy store-bought roasted chicken and crispy herb-seasoned potatoes, you can whip up a satisfying meal in no time. The combination of savory herbs and golden potatoes not only enhances the flavor but also makes for a visually appealing dish that your family and friends will love. Whether you're a novice cook or an experienced chef, this recipe is simple enough to follow and guarantees a hearty meal that requires minimal prep time. Plus, it’s an excellent way to elevate a store-bought roasted chicken into a wholesome homemade dinner. Get ready to impress your loved ones with this easy yet flavorful dish!

Ingredients

store roasted chicken

When using store-roasted chicken, check the label for any added flavors or seasonings. You can enhance the flavor by adding a squeeze of lemon or a drizzle of your favorite sauce before serving. If you're looking for a healthier option, consider using rotisserie chicken without skin.

potatoes

Choose starchy potatoes like Russets for fluffier insides, or waxy potatoes like Yukon Gold for creaminess. You can substitute potatoes with sweet potatoes for a different flavor and added nutrients. Make sure to wash and scrub them well before cutting to remove any dirt.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil adds a rich flavor to the potatoes. If you need a substitution, canola oil or avocado oil works well but will have a milder taste. For added depth, consider infusing the olive oil with garlic or herbs before using it.

dried rosemary

Dried rosemary can be quite strong; crush it between your fingers before adding to release more flavor. If you prefer fresh herbs, use about three times the amount since they are less concentrated. Thyme or oregano can be good substitutes if you're out of rosemary.

dried thyme

Similar to rosemary, crush dried thyme to enhance its aroma. If using fresh thyme, replace with three times the amount. You can also mix in other herbs like sage or parsley for a unique flavor profile.

salt

Use kosher salt for better texture and flavor distribution. If you're watching your sodium intake, consider using a salt substitute or simply reduce the amount. Remember to taste as you go to avoid over-salting.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds more flavor than pre-ground. If you want a kick, consider using white pepper or even a pinch of cayenne for heat. Adjust the amount based on your spice preference.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). This ensures that both the chicken and potatoes cook evenly and get that perfect crispy texture.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Potatoes

    Wash the potatoes thoroughly under running water to remove any dirt. Cut them into wedges, making sure they are of similar size for even cooking.

  • Step 3: Season the Potatoes

    In a large mixing bowl, toss the potato wedges with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of dried rosemary, 1 teaspoon of dried thyme, and salt and pepper to taste. Make sure each wedge is well-coated with the oil and herbs.

  • Step 4: Arrange the Potatoes

    Spread the seasoned potato wedges on a baking sheet in a single layer. This allows the heat to circulate around the potatoes, making them crispy.

  • Step 5: Prepare the Chicken

    Place the store-roasted chicken on a separate baking dish or next to the potatoes on the same baking sheet (if there’s enough space). This will save on cleanup.

  • Step 6: Bake

    Bake both the store-roasted chicken and the herb potatoes in the oven for about 30 minutes. Keep an eye on the potatoes; they should be golden brown and crispy.

  • Step 7: Check Chicken Temperature

    Use a meat thermometer to check that the chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C) to ensure it’s heated through.

  • Step 8: Serve

    Serve the roasted chicken alongside the crispy herb potatoes. You can garnish with fresh herbs for an extra touch!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly wash and cut potatoes?

To wash potatoes, scrub them under cold running water to remove any dirt. Use a vegetable brush for better results. To cut them into wedges, first, cut the potato in half lengthwise, then lay each half flat and cut it into 3-4 wedges, depending on the size.

What is the best way to season my potatoes?

Tossing the potatoes in a bowl with olive oil, dried herbs like rosemary and thyme, salt, and pepper ensures even seasoning. Make sure all wedges are well-coated for the best flavor.

How can I ensure my potatoes are crispy?

To achieve crispy potatoes, make sure they are spread out in a single layer on the baking sheet. This allows the hot air to circulate around them. Also, preheating the oven is crucial for achieving that golden-brown texture.

How can I tell if my chicken is heated through?

The best way to check if the chicken is heated through is to use a meat thermometer. The internal temperature should reach at least 165°F (74°C). If you don’t have a thermometer, cut into the chicken at the thickest part; the juices should run clear, not pink.

What should I do if I don’t have dried rosemary or thyme?

If you don’t have dried rosemary or thyme, you can substitute them with other dried herbs like Italian seasoning, or use fresh herbs if available. Fresh herbs will have a stronger flavor, so you can use about three times the amount.

Is it safe to handle cooked chicken?

Yes, but be sure to wash your hands before and after handling cooked chicken to avoid cross-contamination. Always use clean utensils and cutting boards when preparing and serving food.

What can I serve with roasted chicken and herb potatoes?

Consider adding a side salad, steamed vegetables, or a grain like rice or quinoa to round out the meal. These options add variety and nutrition to your plate.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free and can be made dairy-free if the chicken does not contain any butter or cream. For a low-carb option, substitute the potatoes with roasted cauliflower or a side of steamed vegetables. To cater to dietary restrictions, ensure the store-roasted chicken is free from allergens like nuts and gluten, and consider using organic or free-range chicken for those who prefer ethically sourced meats.

Pairings

To complement the store-roasted chicken and herb potatoes, consider serving with a fresh garden salad dressed with a lemon vinaigrette to brighten the flavors. For beverages, a chilled white wine such as Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied red wine like Pinot Noir pairs beautifully. If you prefer non-alcoholic options, a sparkling water with a splash of lemon or a herbal iced tea would be refreshing.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the roasted chicken on a large platter and arrange the crispy herb potatoes around it for an inviting presentation. Garnish with fresh rosemary or thyme sprigs for a pop of color and added aroma. For a rustic touch, consider serving with warm crusty bread or dinner rolls on the side. If desired, provide a small bowl of garlic aioli or a zesty chimichurri for dipping the potatoes.

Store Roasted Chicken with Herb Potatoes

40 min
$15
600 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeDairy-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main CourseDinner

Tags:

Quick MealComfort FoodFamily Friendly

Description

A deliciously seasoned store-bought roasted chicken served with crispy herb potatoes, perfect for a quick and satisfying meal.

Ingredients

  • store roasted chicken: 1 whole
  • potatoes: 2 large
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • dried rosemary: 1 teaspoon
  • dried thyme: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

11/18/2024
